intro: Lemuropisum edule, commonly known as the edible leaf plant, is a member of the Malvaceae family, characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves and showy flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. The plant is valued for its nutrient-rich leaves, which are often consumed as a vegetable. It produces small, capsule-like fruits containing several seeds. Due to its adaptability and nutritional value, it is cultivated in various parts of the world for both culinary and medicinal purposes.
